intro: Mesembryanthemum dubium, commonly known as the desert star or white groundsel, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers that open in response to sunlight. The plant has a compact, low-growing habit with thick, often hairy leaves that help it conserve water. Its flowers, which are typically yellow or white, bloom in summer and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Mesembryanthemum dubium is well adapted to arid environments and is often used in rock gardens or as a decorative plant in dry landscapes.
